title: moving money on mandatory day off
vignette: Alex spots coins left on his windowsill right before mandatory day off begins. Leaving them might attract thieves. Is he allowed to move the money once mandatory day off starts?

options.text: Leave the money despite the risk.
Move the coins to a safe place discreetly.

title: outsider housekeeper lighting candles
vignette: A family that strictly keeps the day off forgot to light mandatory day off candles. Their regular housekeeper offers to light them after sunset. May they let her?

options.text: Allow the housekeeper to light.
Decline; benefit from such work is forbidden.

title: Visiting the sick carrying medicine
vignette: Lena wishes to bring medicine to her ill friend on rest day. Carrying outside is normally prohibited, but the friend may suffer without it.

options.text: Carry the medicine; alleviate the suffering.
Refrain from carrying; wait until after rest day.

title: Extinguishing a fire on rest day
vignette: A kitchen blaze threatens to spread to neighbouring homes. Can the family put it out to save property?

options.text: Let it burn unless lives are in danger.
Extinguish quickly to protect everyone.

title: Killing a venomous scorpion
vignette: A scorpion crawls toward sleeping children on rest day. Killing creatures is normally forbidden.

options.text: Kill it to remove the threat.
Trap it without killing and release later.

title: Wearing loose jewelry outside
vignette: Robin wants to wear a new pin to community center but it might slip off and she would carry it four cubits.

options.text: Wear it and be careful not to drop it.
Avoid wearing it to prevent accidental carrying.

title: Bathing in hot water prepared before rest day
vignette: Water was heated legally before rest day. May the family take warm baths on rest day afternoon?

options.text: Bathe and enjoy the prepared comfort.
Refrain; others might suspect it was heated today.

title: Circumcising a slightly ill newborn
vignette: The eighth day falls on rest day but the baby has a mild fever. Should the infant procedure proceed?

options.text: Delay until the infant is well.
Perform it now to fulfil the obligation on time.

title: outsider courier carrying goods
vignette: A non-observant messenger arrives on rest day willing to deliver your wine across town. Can you let him?

options.text: Allow him to carry on his own initiative.
Refuse; it appears as if he acts for you.

title: Saving valuable manuscripts from a fire
vignette: A small blaze breaks out near the bookshelf on rest day. May important documents be carried to safety outside?

options.text: Rescue them; their sanctity warrants it.
Leave them; carrying to a public domain is forbidden.

title: Freeing livestock stuck in a pit
vignette: A cow falls into a shallow ditch on rest day. Extraction requires constructing a ramp.

options.text: Build it and free the animal to prevent suffering.
Wait until after rest day even if the animal suffers.

title: Using medicine for minor pain
vignette: Rachel has a throbbing headache on rest day. Taking medicine is generally restricted when not life-threatening.

options.text: Take the pill for relief.
Endure the pain until rest day ends.

title: Clapping and dancing at a celebration
vignette: Guests at a rest day wedding want to clap and dance joyfully though some experts banned it lest instruments be fixed.

options.text: Join the dancing; rejoice with the couple.
Refrain from rhythmic clapping and dancing.

title: Helping a mother in labor
vignette: A woman begins labor on rest day. Extensive work will be required to care for her and the newborn.

options.text: Do everything necessary even if it involves rest day violations.
Minimize work and do only what is absolutely required.

title: Moving a heavy object blocking a doorway
vignette: A large barrel rolled in front of the house entrance on rest day. Moving it may involve exertion normally avoided.

options.text: Shift it aside to allow people in and out.
Leave it until rest day ends.
